clauses.question: 1. What process should the Government use to set a new emissions reduction target in legislation?
clauses.answer: The Government sets a 2050 target in legislation now

clauses.question: 2. If the Government sets a 2050 target now, which is the best target for New Zealand?
clauses.answer: Net Zero Emissions - Net zero emissions across all greenhouse gases by 2050

clauses.question: 3. How should New Zealand meet its targets?
clauses.answer: Domestic emissions reductions (including from new forest planting) and using some emissions reductions from overseas (international carbon units) that have strong environmental safeguards

clauses.question: 4. Should the Zero Carbon Bill allow the 2050 target to be revised if circumstances change?
5. The Government proposes that three emissions budgets of five years each (i.e. covering the next 15 years) be in place at any given time. Do you agree with this proposal?
6. Should the Government be able to alter the last emissions budget (i.e. furthest into the future)?
clauses.answer: No - emissions budgets should not be able to be changed
clauses.notes: Yes if ahead of the desired 2050 outcome (on for the 15 years) and a stronger position is being set to be achieved than expected.

clauses.question: 7. Should the Government have the ability to review and adjust the second emissions budget within a specific range under exceptional circumstances? See p36 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: proper and effective collaboration will insure appropriate negotiations are made early on

clauses.question: 8. Do you agree with the considerations we propose that the Government and the Climate Change Commission take into account when advising on and setting budgets? See p44 Our Climate Your Say
9. Should the Zero Carbon Bill require Governments to set out plans within a certain timeframe to achieve the emissions budgets?
10. What are the most important issues for the Government to consider in setting plans to meet budgets? For example, who do we need to work with, what else needs to be considered?
clauses.notes:
If hours of work for individuals change and expectations on income change, how will banks view mortgage repayments and what will
the expectations be that the workforce operate from office evirons as opposed to being mobile. Does this have an affect on use of

existing infrastructure and dependencies we have developed? Emissions are a centralised and an industrial production problem. I get
the impression that as performance of businesses/industry adapts to only needing to report on adverse effects found out by their

autonomous monitoring (as opposed to stipulated data detail) the responsibility shift has the potential to change/reduce regulatory
resourcing needs.

clauses.question: 11. The Government has proposed that the Climate Change Commission advises on and monitors New Zealand's progress towards its goals. Do you agree with these functions? See p42 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes:
Depend on who the climate change commission is paid by and whether they are seen as impartial and/or representing all parties to

be affected. Are they an independent group or a govt agency?

clauses.question: 12. What role do you think the Climate Change Commission should have in relation to the New Zealand Emissions Trading Scheme (NZ ETS)?
clauses.answer: Advising the Government on policy settings in the NZ ETS
clauses.notes:
if the climate change commission is subject to disincentive to see the outcome to its 2050 goal or one which is even quicker, and

there is no vision for reversing the carbon loss and that being an ongoing role, the advise may stand to resist NZ achieving full
potential

clauses.question: 13. The Government has proposed that Climate Change Commissioners need to have a range of essential and desirable expertise. Do you agree with the proposed expertise? See p45 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: I want to see new blood get involved. We can't afford to have old heads dominating the dialogue. Creativity is important

clauses.question: 14. Do you think the Zero Carbon Bill should cover adapting to climate change?
clauses.notes:
This is a connected function which may or may not need to move at the same pace. Its part of a culture shift and losing the
attachment to typical urban construct/spread.

clauses.question: 15. The Government has proposed a number of new functions to help us adapt to climate change. Do you agree with the proposed functions? See p47 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes:
In my view local authority infrastructure expansion with respect to underground and overhead services should come to an end. Local

sourcing and new construction needs to be completely raised to the fore in the vein of Regen villages which are being built in Europe
and earmarked for North Africa. an urban-rural continuum which does not waste water by producing blackwater - creating un-
necessary risk. The culture around human poo has to make a big shift.

clauses.question: 16. Should we explore setting up a targeted adaptation reporting power that could see some organisations share information on their exposure to climate change risks?
